III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff-to-resident ratio.
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-to-
Description resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation The agency does not have enough staff and operate out of ratio
on second shift almost daily.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was contacted on 2/25/2025. Complainant did not
provide additional information.
On 2/27/2025 a video conference was held with the Chief
Administrator, Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, Staff 5, and the
investigating consultant. During this video conference it was
reported by the Chief Administrator that the facility has been
counting employees in roles such as nurse, teachers, and
therapists in the ratio. It was clarified by Staff 5 that these staff
members could only be counted if they were not on duty for their
typical job function and were on the floor.
On 3/20/2025 the consultant completed a check in with the Chief
Administrator who reported that the ratios were in compliance that
afternoon. The consultant requested that the Chief Administrator
provide documentation to show total number of youth as well as
staff and their positions.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/28/25.
Youth A reported he does not have any concerns with the staff or
how many staff are at the facility. Youth A reported the staff make
sure they have enough people and if they will not then someone
will come over from across the street when the shift changes.
Youth A reported he thinks there is supposed to be one staff to
every five youth. Youth A reported that if someone comes to help
they are not doing any other job when they are doing that.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/28/25.
Youth B reported that things are going well with staff at the facility.
Youth B reported he does not have any concerns regarding how
many staff are working in the afternoons. Youth B reported that he
thinks there are enough staff working and knows if they may not
other people come to make sure. Youth B reported if people come
from across the street or a therapist comes they do not do any
other work when they are working on the floor.
Staff 6 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/28/25.
Staff 6 denied that there is ever a time when there are not enough
staff to account for the five to one ratio required for direct care.
Staff 6 reported it is determined before the shift if they need more
staff to meet the ratio and if they do either other staff come down
to assist or staff come from across the street. Staff 6 denied that
any staff that come to assist are doing multiple jobs at the same
time. Staff 6 denied awareness of where the allegation would
come from that the facility operates under ratio.
2

Staff 7 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/28/25.
Staff 7 reported the facility does not operate with less than the
required ratio, any time. Staff 7 reported they count youth and staff
before the start of the shift to make sure they are in ratio and if
they are not they will obtain staff from across the street or other
roles at the facility to come and serve as direct staff. Staff 7
reported that when therapists or other positions come to serve as
direct staff, they do not do two jobs at once, they serve as direct
staff. Staff 7 reported that she is not sure why it would be alleged
that they operate under ratio and stated that there is a staff there
that likes to cause issues.
Documentation review:
• Facility Policy – Appropriate Staffing Levels dated 02/2025.
The policy specifies that the staff ratio is 5 to 1 during
waking hours and 8 to 1 during sleeping hours.
• Staff roster for 3/20/2025. Roster shows that there were 25
youth placed in the facility and there were 6 Residential
Care Specialists, Supervisor, and a director present. This
exceeds the minimum ratio of 5 to 1.
• Email dated 4/9/2025 from the Chief Administrator. Email
details training of staff roster and breakdown of staff that
come to assist from the other building. Email states that the
individuals from the inpatient unit are frequent fill-ins when
there are gaps in the RTC schedule. Individuals from
inpatient units are paired with an experienced RTC staff
member and receive on the job training. The facility has
instituted a cross-training program for all new staff
completing orientation which they complete before
volunteering to cover RTC shifts.
Analysis A violation is not established regarding the licensing rule. It was
reported by staff and youth that if there are not enough staff prior
to the shift, staff will come to assist from other areas and the ratio
of 5 to 1 will be met. It was consistently denied that nurses,
therapists, or teachers are doing multiple jobs simultaneously.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
